review.review_text:
A little bit of NOLA in the west

Had a wonderful breakfast this morning. Begniets very similar to those in New Orleans as well as coffee with chicory. Quaint atmosphere, good service, and a variety of menu options. Prices were reasonable.

Waited for 20mins before I was seated but it was well worth the wait. I tried the pulled pork eggs benedict with grits and it was delicious. The food was gone in minutes coz I couldn't put my fork down!

Busy little cafe with delicious meals! Our eggs were soft and flavoursome! 

The staff greet you and seat you as you enter even if they’re packed with customers

I had gone for a camping trip with my friend. We came back on a Saturday, and were really hungry. We were at Hilton, returning the rented car. I quickly looked up in Zomato to find any restaurants nearby. It was 2:30 in the afternoon and most restaurants were closed. That's when I noticed this place, with great reviews and around 10 mins walk from Hilton.

It was drizzling and was really cold. This is the time when you look for some comfort food. But we were disappointed on reaching the place, it was really crowded, and people were waiting outside. We still decided to try our luck. I went in and wrote my name on the waiting list board. There were at least 10 people ahead of us. I was not so hopeful and we started searching again and almost decided to get a subway. But then suddenly the crowd reduced, looks like some people in the list didn't turn up.

There were no tables free, but was offered two bar chairs. We quickly accepted and I ordered Grillades & Grits. Meat cooked well in a flavor rich gravy was ultimate! Mashed potatoes and toast were also good. It was accompanied with eggs any style and I ordered poached. Later I felt I should have gone for scrambled eggs, a better combination with toast.

Ambience: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Value for Money: 4/5

Now this Creol in San Francisco.. And yes our eyes were bigger than our stomachs so this what we ordered: red beans and rice, chicken etouffee, hush puppies, catfish and wings.. Everything was awesome however wasn't impress with the fried wings but we washed it down with hurricanes and mimosas. So if you on Polk St it is a must stop.. And they have these watermelon pickles which was good and not what I expected.. Loved this place and yes we have to go boxes.

This place is amazing!! This is the best meal that I've had in a while! Best biscuits I've ever had. I never eat biscuits because they're usually too dry. These were moist, soft, flaky and crunchy a bit on the outside. The greens and Mac and cheese were delicious! This is soul food. I felt like I was back home at grandma's.
This is a good casual restaurant to know about. The shrimp po’ boy was really good and the biscuits are amazing! The fried chicken was good, but not great.
Eating here was such a treat! Everything we had was delicious. We had the verity pack beignets and all of them were fantastic. Coffee was really good. They get busy, so get there early:)

Came here with my family to celebrate my nephew’s birthday.

The food is good, the biscuits are homemade and everything was delicious. The space inside is small, so there was a line on the sidewalk as we approached. Write your name on the chalkboard inside and wait for your name to be called.

We waited 30 minutes to get seated. I started with the okra and sausage gumbo and the coffee was also strong.

We come here whenever families in town.

Always packed. Always with a long line. Average waiting time is one hour during pre-peak times but the wait is definitely worth it. Large serving of food that really gives value to your money. Breakfasts at Brenda's are definitely a treat for the soul. Oh, did I forget that their staff are accommodating too?

Being from the Midwest and a cooker of Southern soul myself I tend to not expect much from the Bay area in regards to Southern cooking. Brenda's did very little to change my opinion. My sister had a gift card so we stopped in and I got the fried chicken dinner with sides and she had a shrimp PO boy. Freshly prepared and about as unseasoned as it can get. looked very nice coming out but the chicken was fried too hard and nothing over all was very memorable about the meal the service was good however. Oh how I miss Powells Soul Food
Chouette resto, bouffe excellente, serveuse agréable. Et des beignets au chocolat qui goûtent le ciel! Portions généreuses, nous n’avons pas terminé nos assiettes.

Had to wait for almost an hour just to get in due to the long waiting list for lunch. It was definitely worth it. The food was warming to the soul as the name suggests. Tried the crayfish brioche bun. The bun was perfect, warm and fluffy on the inside. The crayfish filling was moist and succulent. Tried the pork belly with warm cheesy grit soups. Never had anything remotely like that before but it was really warming our hearts for that wintry afternoon. The most memorable food I had in San Francisco.

This restaurant gets a 4.5 because of its caring attitude which as a foreigner (Arkansan) doesn't often experience in CA and certain northern states... Walked 2 miles just to visit this location. BTW be careful if you choose to walk from downtown. I was not personally concerned, but I would not want my wife or kids to walk through some of the areas I did coming from China town. I had the burger and told them to load it up (fried egg, bacon, and goat cheese) ... was very tasty. Just wouldn't do the goat cheese again (too rich for me)... The fried black eye peas were not good though, but they were free so I can not complain. Someone I was with asked me how I would describe it, I replied it is American food with some French infusions. If you go here, just make sure you read the instructions on how to get seated! Worth a stop if you are looking for a change/good food.

One of the top restaurants in San Francisco.

Get the Shrimp & Grits. It's a must.

Get a biscuit. It's a must.

Try the preserve on you table.

Coffee is good too.

This place is likely in every tourist book and deservingly so. It's that good. It's worth the wait. Is you get here no later than 15 minutes before they open in Sunday you will get a table.

Try Brenda's Meat & Three too. The sister restaurant in NOPA. (Not Napa)

I've been here countless times over the years and have never had a bad meal. It's always good all of the time.

I've been wanting to eat here since 2014 but didn't have enough time to do so.So,we went to the city and saw the long line from outside.It was a good sign even if we had to queue for an hour. We had the beignet sampler which was crawfish,apple,chocolate and traditional.They were all good,fluffy and the right kind of crust. The shrimp and grits was really spot on.Perfect done ess of the shrimps,very flavorful tomato "gravy" on a bed of heavenly .The omelette with link sausage was also great and a really hefty serving.The gumbo was perfect with just the right amount of rice.

OK, you must queue. Always. And I personally hate queueing, which is considered normal in SF. But it's really worthy for Brenda's Beignets, Eggs Benedict, and the Crab Bisque. Everything is delicious and even if it's crowded, this place is so homey. Great choice!

Best breakfast location in San Francisco. 

Sweet potato pancakes....could not top eating. 

Shrimp and goat cheese omelette.  Rich and wonderful.

This place lived up to the hype and ratings on Zomato. We ordered the beignet flight with my favorite being the crawfish, but they were all very good. We also ordered the gumbo and Grillades & Grits, both were delicious. I would come back and try more items on the menu! Allison Smith
Awesome food and good service. Highly recommend the pork belly as well as the shrimp and goat cheese hash with a cream biscuit and cinnamon and apricot jam

We were referred here and wowza what a disappointment. They sat us pretty quick for a table of 7. Our waiter took our drink order and brought it out decently fast. When it came to ordering, our waitress got pretty frustrated with my wife's question about the pancakes, as she wanted to order one pancake for our 5 year old daughter. She told us there isn't a children's pancake, so my wife asked to order one pancake as a side dish to her meal instead and our waitress got this frustrated look and with an attitude said you can't do that. My brother in law then pointed out well why can't we just order the single pancake they have listed in the sides menu. She said well yeah you can that I guess. Seemed to me that she had an attitude like we were inconveniencing her by actually making her think about her job instead of just writing down orders. Waitresses are in customer service where the assistance of the customer is their sole purpose, and it seemed like she has lost sight of that. We finished ordering and then randomly our waitress changed to a different lady. Not sure if it had to do with our ordering, but usually when a waitress change happens, they explain it to you as introduce the one taking over, none of that happened. 

Our new waitress asked if we were going to add on the donut things and explained a little of what they were and we said sure. Our new waitress was already leaps and bounds better than the last. I expected under appetizers to come out first, as they did by about 10 seconds as our breakfast immediately followed. 

I had the steak strips with grits and 2 eggs, my wife had the special which was a type of sandwich with sausage, cheddar and eggs and spicy potatoes on the side, with my daughter getting the pancake. All of the food was very forgettable and underwhelming. My grits were bland with the steak strips having a very microwaved feel, like I was eating someone's leftover food from the night before. My eggs however were cooked as ordered. My wife didn't like her food, so I tasted it to get a personal feel. Her potatoes had a Franks hot sauce taste like someone just poured sauce on overcooked potatoes. They were not something I would ever choose again for sure. My daughter said her pancake was okay, but as a 5 year old who never complains about her food. My brother in law also got pancakes to split with his daughter so I asked him and he said they were not very good. 

We then tried the beignets. My moms husband tried the crawfish one first and I about saw him spit it back out faster than you can say crawfish. The look on his face said stay far far away from them. I tried the chocolate one and it was okay. My mom seemed to like them ok, but definitely didn't blow us away. 

Summarized, expect hit and miss service with mediocre to pukish food. My friend who referred me here has been officially banned from giving me future advice.

Serving was huge! We tried the beignets filled with ghiradelli choc and they were delicious. It came in a plate of 3 big pieces. We also ordered the hangtown fry and crispy pork belly. The hangtown fry was a little underwhelming but the crispy pork belly was cooked well. Would like to come back and try their BFC!

Went to Brenda's for brunch during our trip to San Francisco. It was fabulous! The food is incredible, especially the crawfish beignets! They also have fantastic coffee and our entrees were almost coma inducing! Make sure you come hungry! The service and ambiance were excellent. The meal was well worth the wait!

Brenda's French Soul Food is one of the gems of San Francisco. You can stop reading now, because the rest of the review all boils down to that first sentence. You're still going? I admire your dedication. Speaking of dedication, no restaurant in the City is more dedicated to the art of Creole cuisine than Brenda's, a famed brunch spot with all the feel of a New Orleans' bistro. Each dish is crafted in traditional Southern style, with noticeable nods to the French origin behind it all. Jambalaya, Étouffée, and Red Beans and Rice highlight a short menu that changes little between lunch and dinner. Four varieties of Beignet are offered all day, including a crawfish version that is among the best in the country. Perhaps the single brightest star is the Gumbo, a lovable stew of Chicken, Andouille, and Okra. Though it lacks the smokiness and deep roux I favor, Brenda's version brings back memories Paul Prudhomme's classic version popularized at Commander's Palace in NOLA. Buttermilk Fried Chicken might be the most popular item on the menu, though saying that hypes the dish up a little more than it deserves. The bird is delicious and crispy, but lacks the flavor and tenderness of some better Southern fried chicken recipes. Brenda's Shrimp and Grits, however, is perhaps second to none West of the Mississippi. While hot food is obviously Brenda's specialty, the other aspects of the restaurant are far from lacking. Oysters are one of the first things on the menu, and the sandwich section is filled with classics like Po Boys and Muffuletta. Every dish is worth its price, and comes in good portions served by friendly and helpful staff. This is one of those restaurant's you go to once in a lifetime if you don't have the privilege on living nearby, and is a spot that needs to be bookmarked for anyone's trip to San Francisco. Brenda's, with their legendary brunch, beloved Beignets, and stunning dinner menu, truly does New Orleans justice from 2,000 miles away.

Great unpretentious, authentic place. Good, informative service, no attitude, happy to explain all the food to a novice customer. Really hearty, home-cooked, filling French style southern / Cajun fare. We loved this place and went back a couple times, breakfast and dinner. Reasonable prices, huge servings. And unlike anything I can get back home in Oz.  great decor and atmos, esp in evening. An essential SF experience.

Amazing, we walked in (from out of town) not knowing it was still brunch. Happily surprised to say the least we then had some incredible French crole. Pork belling on a bed of cheese grits as well as their scramble with hash browns. Amazing to say the least

Another one that's been on the list for years. Thought it might be another one of those overrated places. Not so. The crawfish beignets were excellent. For the price, a decent amount of crawfish in the most delicious sauce, encased within a deep fried pastry. I probably would have preferred to pay more and get more filling as you're pretty much left with half an empty shell at the end, but no major complaints as it was really quite delicious. The pancakes were seriously massive. Honest to god at least a 2+ person meal. Quite fluffy given their size but not exactly light. Quite tasty.

Things to try: eggs benedict (fried chicken), watermelon sweet tea, Beignet flight. 

We waited for about 25 minutes at 3pm on a sunday. Just go in and put your name on the list. It went relatively fast because we were just two people. They serve brunch 8am until 3pm and then from 3pm onwards it's the lunch and dinner menu. 

I loved the food...it made me feel like I was back in New Orleans. The eggs benedict was served on a delicious biscuit and I had a side of hash instead of the grits. There are so many more items on the menu I need to try...must go back!!

I don't care how hungry you are - get the benget flight! Each one is giant so i recommend sharing but they are honestly the best thing ever! The brunch was absolutely awesome - huge plates though! Got the grits, the best biscuit I've ever eaten, and the shrimp omelette which was done perfectly. Definitely one of the best brunches I've ever had!!
Incredible New Orleans style dishes. Haven't had anything on the menu that wasn't superb. Prepare for wait, but ALWAYS worth it! Portions are huge. Beignets are the bomb!

This is a roll yourself out of the restaurant kind of brunch!  Don't leave without having the crawfish beignets...so good.  I ordered the fried chicken eggs benedict..wow!  Bold flavors.  We waited 1  and a half hours for a table for 6... seems like the norm, but there's a cafe next door to get coffee.

Breakfast at its best. Brenda's is definitely worth the wait. Even in the rain, like I did.  Their banana pancakes are the stuff of legend! And the beignets are good even when cold! I will make a stop here every time Im in San Francisco.

Crawfish Beignets. Tasty and 'down the hatch' good

-----25 Apr, 2015-----
Three Granny Smith Apple Beignets. Beignets were so tasty!

-----25 Apr, 2015-----
Shrimp & Grits. Shrimp and grits were truly amazing. Would eat them again and again and again.

-----25 Apr, 2015-----
Sausage and Goat Cheese Omelette. Omelette was good.

Great Cajun Food. My wife and I gave Brenda's a shot the first night we were in SF for a weekend visit from Texas and were not disappointed! Grab a Dixie beer (nothing special, but got a nice New Orleans charm) and eat really well but save room for the beignets which are out of this world.

Food and dervice plummets. I went to brendas about a year ago for breakfast an was tunned out by the good food and service. Want to sit there and have lunch and dinner. Biscuits were fluffyl and light and has browns had real creaole flavoring. My recent visit was just average. Biscuits were doughy and potatoes had no flavor. Lastly , the waitress had the personality of a rock

Best food ever. Ordered the beignets flight so yummy. Service is excellent . We did have to wait 1 hour but one we were seated the service and food were worth it . Shrimp poboy so good large servings.

This place did not disappoint - lived up to the hype. Friendly staff - throughout our visit.
Garlic Shrimp Gratin appetizer with my Creole Bloody Mary.
Brenda's Fried Chicken - and ..... no room for dessert.

Awesome all the way around - can't wait to go back.
The Beignet Flight. A sampler of their beignets: sweet, savory and regular. A nice dish to share.

Worth the wait!. Absolutely delish! The only problem is the huge portions... if that could be a problem! The shrimp and goat cheese omelette was amazing. As a south Carolinian I prefer my grits a little thicker but I think that is just personal preference

Fantastic!. The food was exceptional - the best grits I ever had - charming atmosphere and great service.
What's not to love?

Can't wait to come back.
Bottom line. Go on a week day and try the beignet sampler. loved the energy in this place.
Black Beans and Rice was delicious. Reasonably priced too. I'll be back on my next trip to SFO.

We spend a lot of time visiting NOLA so had to try this restaurant for breakfast when we were in SanFran. Best breakfast I have ever had anywhere..ever! If you are not eating here you are missing out.
One of my favorite restaurants in SF. The BFC is a must try for every one.

Brenda's French Soul food. We went to this restaurant around 11 and the line was outside the door. My husband and I waited about 45 minutes before we were seated. We ordered the Beignets sampler which was by far the best thing we had there. I had the pumpkin pancakes which were also really good. My husband ordered some eggs and beef with grits. His meal was really disappointing. The grits were average, we have had better in the Outer Banks of North Carolina. His eggs were not cooked as he wanted it and the beef was not very flavorful. Despite the fact that I liked the food and liked it, I did not think it was worth the wait or the cost.

Never going back. service is horrible. Bottom line: the food is good but the service is horrible. I won't be going back. 

A family friend is moving away for good. To celebrate, we decided to take him to Brenda's. Big mistake. 

First offense, our waitress gave us the coldest reception imaginable. I'm not saying you have to bow or something crazy like that but at least pretend youre slightly happy customers are patronizing your establishment. 

Second offense, she brought our check super early and without our request. We were not even half way done eating when she brought it. Our guest picked up on the vibe instantly saying "who asked her for the check? are they trying to rush us out?" yup, that's exactly what they were doing. 

The bill was a little over 60 bucks. I placed 80 down since i didnt have change, and continued to eat and converse. She picked it up and said "I'll be back with your change" Honestly at that point I was going to let her keep the change which was well over 20%. I didn't let her know that though.

From that point on I noticed that every waiter that passed gave us a weird look. Obviously wanting us to hurry and leave. The looks lingered more and more as time went on. I'm annoyed but chose to ignore it. After all it hadn't been a full hour since we were seated. I waited in line outside for longer than that. AND I was spending a decent amount of money. We were treating a guest and I was NOT about to be rushed. 

Anyways, the "can we box this up for you?" "can we get anything else for you?" visits from the waiter became more and more frequent coupled by the random walkby passive aggressive stares from other employees. Finally, a heavyset, dark haired waitress that we hadn't seen before comes over and removes everything from the table. This was the conversation that followed:

Waitress: can we get something else for you?
Me: no. We're fine thanks. 
Waitress: ok. Thanks for visiting us. (pause). BUUUBYE. (then she walked off with the same weird stare as if she wanted to say "now get out")

That was the last straw. I called her back and reminded her that our original waitress never brought my change back. She seemed surprised; probably knowing that her attitude just cost her friend a tip. I removed everything from the change tray, placed it in my pocket, and left. 

The service used to be great here but I guess in their success they've become arrogant. Maybe they figure their food is so good, they can afford to treat people anyway they choose and theyll keep coming back. Thats their prerogative, but I know at least four people they won't be seeing again.

So disappointed in my breakfast here =(. I was really excited to come here for breakfast after reading all the stellar reviews here and on trip advisor.
i even dragged my boyfriend through the shady part of eddy street to get here from our hotel (which was located near the powell street bart station) - people weren't kidding when they said a part of that walk over is super sketchy. i wouldn't ever walk down that way again - and i have walked through some pretty sketchy areas. but anyway.
on to the food! i am a HUGE fan of cafe du monde in new orleans - their beignets cannot be beat. The beignets I had at Brenda's were not good. i wouldn't recommend them to anyone. i couldn't even finish one :( :( :( these ones were dry and super dense like eating tasteless fried dough. nothing good about it.
i ordered the french toast - there was nothing special about it - i could have made it at home the exact same way.
my bf had the egg and bacon tartine which was ok except the eggs tasted like liquid eggs - not fresh scrambled eggs.
i think maybe the weekend brunch menu may have more exciting options on it.
anyway we were there at 10ish on a week day and the place wasn't full so no line up.

perhaps i was expecting too much and it didn't meet my expectations, not that the food was terrible but it was the same as any other place. also the chicory cafe au lait was a huge disappointment - not comparable at all to cafe du monde in new orleans which i love!

Holy crap!!!. Amazing!!! The biengets where amazing ....get the sampler 4 of them .... Must share !!!! I had the pork belly special......omg!!! Perfect cheddar grits .....onion jam.....poached egg.....holy heart attack !!!! But so worth it !!!!

Amazing! Great service, classy decor, and, most importantly, spectacular breakfast food. Can't wait to go back for lunch! The shrimp and grits are a must for adventurous breakfast eaters like me. The andouille omelette and pancakes are delicious as well. Brenda's is also very reasonably priced, especially for the high level of service and food quality I received. I give this restaurant an A++.
